sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Leaders of the Council of Europe's 46 member states will establish what they call a register of damage caused by the Russian Federation's aggression in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's a first step towards an international compensation mechanism decided during a summit of the organization on Tuesday and Wednesday in the Icelandic capital of Reykjavik.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: All 46 countries agree that the Kremlin should compensate victims in Ukraine and help rebuild the nation once the conflict is over.

sentences.sentence: The new body will be based in The Hague in the Netherlands and may come to include a claims commission and a compensation fund. The question still remains, though, of how damages to Ukraine will be paid for and how those responsible can be brought to justice.

sentences.sentence: The Council of Europe's Secretary General says the body intends to support international efforts to establish a judicial body to prosecute Russia's crimes of aggression, the literal act of invading another country. The United States, Japan and Canada have also joined efforts participating in the Council of Europe as observer states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: One by one, Chinese President Xi Jinping met with attendees as he hosted the China-Central Asia Summit held in Xi'an, a city historically linked to the Silk Road network of global trade routes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Coinciding with the G7 leaders' meeting in Japan, experts say this summit reflects Beijing's desire to strengthen regional influence and fill the vacuum that Russia's war in Ukraine has created in the former Soviet states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The first of its kind in 31 years, the summit aims to expand China's reach and advance transport links.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Beijing's trade with Central Asian countries reached 64 billion euros in 2022, and in the first quarter of this year rose by 22%.
